Signs and Symptoms Approximate number of patients (when available) Hand tremor 5% Adult onset - Autosomal dominant inheritance - Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers - Degeneration of anterior horn cells - Distal sensory impairment - Fasciculations - Gait disturbance - Gliosis - Hyperlipidemia - Mildly elevated creatine phosphokinase - Peripheral neuropathy - Proximal amyotrophy - Proximal muscle weakness - Slow progression -
